title: 2020 Peugeot 208 review: can this beautiful French supermini really change the way we drive?
text:
In the 36 years since the Peugeot 205 was launched, more than 22 million of it and its successors found owners. That's more units than Ford has shifted of its Fiesta since 1976, and a higher rate of sales than VW’s larger Golf. With that in-house-designed 205, Peugeot bought a vivacity, ride quality and sheer brio to the supermini class that few could compete with.

And if subsequent models (the 206 in 1998, 207 in 2006 and 208 in 2012) didn’t quite have the same substance, the first owners at least didn’t seem to mind. These little cars appealed to young and old, and women and men alike.

So now we get the, erm, 208 again. Peugeot’s number progression was halted a few years ago; presumably someone...
description: In the 36 years since the Peugeot 205 was launched, more than 22 million of it and its successors found owners.
